Hamilton Court: We have two indoor courts on campus, including 1 indoor court located at the University of Waikato Sports Centre and 1 indoor court at the University of Waikato Sports Centre. We also have 1 outdoor court located at the University of Waikato Sports Centre.

Outdoor Courts: Currently in preparation outdoor courts at the University of Waikato Sports Centre.

Outdoor Fields: We have three full-size rugby pitches, one full-size soccer pitch, and one full-size cricket pitch. We also have a 400m athletics track and a high jump area.

Our courts and fields are available for students, staff and the public to use. We offer a variety of sports including badminton, basketball, volleyball and futsal.

We also offer a variety of classes including yoga, pilates, zumba and more.

For more information, please visit our website or contact us at sports@waikato.ac.nz

1. Animal Rights & Climate Justice: We take action on a variety of issues including animal rights, climate justice, and more. We are the first student group in Aotearoa to achieve Fair Trade University status.

2. The proposal for the Asian Law Student Association (ALSA) has been approved by the Waikato Student Union. ALSA is a student-led organisation that aims to promote legal education, legal research and legal practice among Asian students in New Zealand.

3. The Waikato Student Radio Society is a student-led organisation that aims to provide a platform for students to share their music, ideas, and stories. The society broadcasts on 88.4 FM and online at waikatoradio.co.nz.
